data.que: State the laws of reflection of light.
data.ans: 1) The angle of incidence is equal to the angle of reflection. 2) The incident ray, reflected ray, and normal all lie in the same plane.

data.que: What is the principal axis of a spherical mirror?
data.ans: The straight line passing through the pole and the center of curvature of the mirror.

data.que: Define the focal length of a concave mirror.
data.ans: The distance between the pole and the principal focus of the mirror.

data.que: What type of image is formed by a concave mirror when the object is at infinity?
data.ans: A highly diminished, real, and inverted image at the focus.

data.que: What type of image is formed by a convex mirror for any position of the object?
data.ans: A virtual, erect, and diminished image between the pole and focus.

data.que: State the mirror formula.
data.ans: 1/f = 1/v + 1/u, where f = focal length, v = image distance, u = object distance.

data.que: What is the magnification produced by a mirror?
data.ans: It is the ratio of the height of the image to the height of the object (M = h’/h = v/u).

data.que: Define refraction of light.
data.ans: The bending of light when it passes from one medium to another due to change in speed.

data.que: State Snell’s law of refraction.
data.ans: n1 sin i = n2 sin r, where i = angle of incidence, r = angle of refraction.

data.que: What is the refractive index of a medium?
data.ans: The ratio of the speed of light in vacuum to the speed of light in that medium.

data.que: Define the principal focus of a convex lens.
data.ans: The point on the principal axis where rays parallel to the axis converge after refraction.

data.que: What is the lens formula?
data.ans: 1/f = 1/v - 1/u, where f = focal length, v = image distance, u = object distance.

data.que: What is the power of a lens?
data.ans: The reciprocal of the focal length in meters. Unit: Dioptre (D).

data.que: What type of image is formed by a convex lens when the object is at 2F?
data.ans: A real, inverted, and same-sized image at 2F on the other side.

data.que: What type of image is formed by a concave lens?
data.ans: A virtual, erect, and diminished image between the lens and its focus.

data.que: What is total internal reflection?
data.ans: When light travels from a denser to a rarer medium and the angle of incidence exceeds the critical angle, it is completely reflected back.

data.que: Give one application of total internal reflection.
data.ans: Optical fibres used in communication.

data.que: What is the critical angle?
data.ans: The angle of incidence in the denser medium for which the angle of refraction in the rarer medium is 90°.

data.que: Which type of mirror is used as a rear-view mirror in vehicles?
data.ans: A convex mirror.

data.que: Which type of mirror is used by dentists to see enlarged images of teeth?
data.ans: A concave mirror.

data.que: Which type of lens is used to correct myopia?
data.ans: A concave lens.

data.que: Which type of lens is used to correct hypermetropia?
data.ans: A convex lens.

data.que: What is the nature of the image formed by a plane mirror?
data.ans: Virtual, erect, and of the same size as the object.

data.que: What is the relation between focal length and radius of curvature of a mirror?
What is dispersion of light?
data.ans: The splitting of white light into its constituent colours when it passes through a prism.

data.que: Why does refraction occur?
data.ans: Because the speed of light changes when it enters a medium of different optical density.

data.que: What is the sign convention for mirrors?
data.ans: Distances measured against the direction of incident light are negative, and those measured along the direction are positive.

data.que: What is the sign convention for lenses?
data.ans: Object distance is taken negative, image distance positive if on the opposite side of the object, and focal length positive for convex lens, negative for concave lens.

data.que: What is the unit of power of a lens?
data.ans: Dioptre (D).

data.que: What is the nature of the image formed by a concave mirror when the object is between focus and pole?
data.ans: Virtual, erect, and magnified.
